Milabrega's Regalia

ADVERTISEMENT

General Notes[edit]

Milagrega's Regalia is very much designed for just one character, the Paladin. It adds a substantial +3 to all skills, but requires four prime item slots to do it. Just about any Paladin can get as much or more +skills from a decent scepter and Tarnhelm, and then wear much better armor and shield.

These are the stats for the set in Diablo II Expansion Pack: Lord of Destruction, where there are partial set bonuses and hidden item bonuses.

  • Item level (ilvl): Used in many in-game calculations. Monsters must be of this level to drop the item.
  • Character level (clvl): The character level you need to be to be able to wear or equip the item.
  • Hidden bonuses stack together. For instance, if an item has a bonus for two items and a bonus for three items, and three items are worn, both the bonus for two items and for three items will become active.
  • It is possible to gamble Set and Unique items in v1.09+. The odds are roughly 1/1000 for Set items and 1/2000 for Unique items.
  • Items with Rarity are expressed as a chance out of 1000. IE 78/1000 would mean that out of every 1000 set items of that base item that drop, 78 of them will be this particular one.

Weapon Notes[edit]

  • Damage Bonus: This determines how you multiply the item damage by your stats to reach the actual damage. Multiply by the listed value per 100 points in that stat. All bows are 100 Dex, almost all melee weapons are 100 Str, most throwing weapons are 50/50.
  • Weapon Speed: A relative comparison to other weapons of the same type. 0 is the base -10, -20, etc is faster, 10, 20, etc is slower, always in increments of 10. Each 10 is equivalent to an SIAS item. Previously items were listed with WSM modified by IAS on the items, we have revised this to show the Weapons base speed (WSM) before ANY IAS.
  • Range: Relevant to melee weapons only. From 1 (least) to 5 (most) in D2X. Numbers are fixed across item classes: a 3 javelin = a 3 sword = a 3 hammer, etc.

Armor Notes[edit]

  • Light Armor: 0% stamina drain and speed penalty.
  • Medium Armor: +50% stamina drain and 5% speed penalty.
  • Heavy Armor: +100% stamina drain and 10% speed penalty.

Shield Notes

  • Shield Blocking information can be found on the shields page.
  • Smite damage is for the Paladin only.
  • Weight: All shields are light, medium, or heavy. In Diablo II this only matters for tower shields, which slow your running speed and increase stamina drain 10%. In D2X it will probably effect blocking speed as well as running speed.
  • shael rune doesn't improve blocking ability

* When wearing another item of this set, the defense of this armor will increase to 468. ** When wearing another two items of this set, the defense of this shield will increase to 53.

Set Bonuses[edit]

Good bonuses over all, but the 8% life steal is sort of wasted with such a low damage weapon. The weapon damage makes this not really useful for melee paladins, but since a Hammerdin can do better equip bonuses easily, there's no real clear candidate to wear this gear. With some bigger bonuses it could become useful in the Expansion though.

Set Attributes/Bonus Item Slots Used Item Slots Free
Partial Set Bonuses:
Wearing any 2 Items: 75 to Attack Rating
Wearing any 3 Items: 125 to Attack Rating

Full Set Bonus:
2 to Paladin Skill Levels
10% Mana Stolen Per Hit
8% Life Stolen Per Hit
15% Poison Resist 		One-handed Weapon

Diablo II[edit]

These are the stats for the set in Diablo II, where there are no partial set bonuses or hidden item bonuses.

  • Smite Damage only applies to the Paladin.


Item Item Name Attributes Commentary
Milabrega's Rod
War Scepter 		12-22 1H Damage
150% Damage to Undead
140 Durability
55 Str Required
Pal Swing Speed: Very Fast
1 to Paladin Skills
Enhanced Damage
Clvl Req:17 		Nice swing speed for the Paladin, but not enough damage to use as a melee weapon with great success, and it lacks the Paladin-mandatory Ignores/Lowers Target Defense.

Ancient Armor 		218-233 Defense
120 Durability

Damage Reduced by 2
Attacker Takes Damage of 3
Clvl Req: 17 		Decent Defense, but not for Ancient Armor, and the magical modifiers are very poor.

Crown 		25-45 Defense
100 Durability

60 Durability

Chance to Block %:
Pal: 38%
Bar/Ama: 33%
Nec/Sor: 28%
2-5 Smite Damage
25 Defense
20% Find Magic Item
Clvl Req: 17 		Mediocre blocking %, but the magic find, almost impossible to get on a shield, makes this one useful to characters trying for max item find gear.

Set Bonuses[edit]

Good bonuses over all, but the 8% life steal is sort of wasted with such a low damage weapon. The weapon damage makes this not really useful for melee paladins, but since a Hammerdin can do better equip bonuses easily, there's no real clear candidate to wear this gear. With some bigger bonuses it could become useful in the Expansion though.
